36  const double KSIntDecayCalculatorGlukhovExcitation::p_coefficients[3][4] = { {5.8664e8,-0.3634 ,-16.704,51.07 },
37  {5.4448e9,-0.03953,-1.5171,5.115 },
38  {1.9153e9,-0.11334,-3.1140,12.913}
39  };
40 
41  const double KSIntDecayCalculatorGlukhovExcitation::T_a_tilde = 0.31578;
42 
43  const double KSIntDecayCalculatorGlukhovExcitation::b_ex[3][3][3] = {{{14.557 , 0.7418 , -0.0437},
44  {-8.8432 , 5.3981 , -2.6255},
45  {10.9688 , -19.720 , 9.0861}},
46 
47  {{1.5675 , 0.0791 , -0.0045},
48  {-1.0648 , 0.7484 , -0.3610},
49  {0.9096 , -1.5654 , 0.6850}},
50 
51  {{4.4430 , 0.2415 ,-0.0212},
52  {-2.4783 , 1.2168 ,-0.5731},
53  { 2.9479 ,-5.1645 , 2.2992}}};

55 
56  void KSIntDecayCalculatorGlukhovExcitation::CalculateLifeTime( const KSParticle& aParticle,
57  double& aLifeTime )
58  {
59  long long tPID = aParticle.GetPID();
60  if ( (tPID == fTargetPID && fTargetPID != 0) || ( (tPID >= fminPID) && ( tPID <= fmaxPID)) )
61  {
62  int n = aParticle.GetMainQuantumNumber();
63  // int l = aParticle.GetSecondQuantumNumber();
64 
65  aLifeTime = 1./( CalculateSpontaneousDecayRate(n,1)
66  *CalculateRelativeExcitationRate(n,1,fTemperature));
67  } else
68  {
69  aLifeTime = std::numeric_limits<double>::max();
70  }
71  return;
72  }
73 
74  void KSIntDecayCalculatorGlukhovExcitation::ExecuteInteraction( const KSParticle& anInitialParticle,
75  KSParticle& aFinalParticle,
76  KSParticleQueue& /*aSecondaries*/)
77  {
78  aFinalParticle.SetTime( anInitialParticle.GetTime() );
79  aFinalParticle.SetPosition( anInitialParticle.GetPosition() );
80  aFinalParticle.SetMomentum( anInitialParticle.GetMomentum() );
81 
82  if ( (anInitialParticle.GetPID() == fTargetPID && fTargetPID != 0) || ( (anInitialParticle.GetPID() >= fminPID) && ( anInitialParticle.GetPID() <= fmaxPID)) )
83  {
84  int n = anInitialParticle.GetMainQuantumNumber();
85  int l = anInitialParticle.GetSecondQuantumNumber();
86 
87  aFinalParticle.SetLabel( GetName() );
88  aFinalParticle.SetMainQuantumNumber(n+1);
89 
90  if( l==0 )
91  aFinalParticle.SetSecondQuantumNumber(l + 1);
92  else if (l == n-1)
93  aFinalParticle.SetSecondQuantumNumber(l - 1);
94  else if (KRandom::GetInstance().Bool(0.5))
95  aFinalParticle.SetSecondQuantumNumber(l - 1);
96  else
97  aFinalParticle.SetSecondQuantumNumber(l + 1);
98 
99  fStepNDecays = 1;
100  fStepEnergyLoss = 0.;
101 
102  }
103 
104  return;
105  }
106 
107  double KSIntDecayCalculatorGlukhovExcitation::CalculateSpontaneousDecayRate( int n, int l)
108  {
109  if (l > 2 || l < 0 || n<0)
110  intmsg(eError) << GetName() << ": Only l states 0,1,2 available for Rydberg decay" << eom;
111 
112  return p_coefficients[l][0]/(n*n*n)*(1.+p_coefficients[l][1]/n+p_coefficients[l][2]/(n*n)+p_coefficients[l][3]/(n*n*n));
113  }
114 
115  double KSIntDecayCalculatorGlukhovExcitation::tau(double T)
116  {
117  return std::pow(100.0/T,1./3.);
118  }
119 
120  double KSIntDecayCalculatorGlukhovExcitation::a_ex(int l,int i,double T)
121  {
122  double tTau = tau(T);
123  return b_ex[l][i][0]+b_ex[l][i][1]*tTau+b_ex[l][i][2]*tTau*tTau;
124  }
125 
126  double KSIntDecayCalculatorGlukhovExcitation::x(int n, double T)
127  {
128  return 100./(n*std::pow(T,1./3.));
129  }
130 
131  double KSIntDecayCalculatorGlukhovExcitation::CalculateRelativeExcitationRate(int n, int l, double T)
132  {
133  if (l > 2 || l < 0 || n<0)
134  intmsg(eError) << "KSIntDecayCalculatorGlukhovExcitation: Only l states 0,1,2 available for Rydberg decay" << eom;
135 
136  return (a_ex(l,0,T)+a_ex(l,1,T)*x(n,T)+a_ex(l,2,T)*x(n,T)*x(n,T))
137 
138  /(n*n*(std::exp(T_a_tilde*1000000/(n*n*n*T))-1)) ;
139 
140  }
141 
142 
143 }
